text.content:
Ms. Avivapatient was on time for today's visit.  We discussed depression, 
suicidal thoughts, safety plan, current Rx.

Patient denies thoughts of hopelessness, plans for suicide.

 
            MENTAL HEALTH SCREENING TRIAGE

 
The items below were discussed with veteran in person.
 
1. What is the specific mental health problems/concerns: 
    Depression
 
 
2. Lethal Risk Evaluation: 
  A. Do you currently have thoughts of harming yourself or anyone else?
      No
 
  B. Do you intend or plan to harm yourself or anyone else? 
      No
 
  C. Have you been taking any preparatory behaviors for suicide or homicide? 
      No
 
  D. Have you ever attempted suicide or homicide in the past?
      No
 
  E. Do you have a family member or close friend who you can confide 
     in/reach out to? 
      Yes
 
  Clinical Conclusion: Low Lethal Risk
 
Current Rx of Venlafaxine is 225mg SA daily.  This is working well for the 
patient.

Diagnosis: Depression
Duration of visit: 20 Mins.
Treatment Provided: Individual Counseling, medication management
Plan: RTC - 6 months, or sooner if needed
text.author: PSYCHIATRIST,ONE
